titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Records of the Office of the Vice Provost for Research RG.5.9
titlestmt.author: Nicole Greenhouse

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2025-03-13 19:16:46 UTC.

did.unittitle: Records of the Office of the Vice Provost for Research

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: New York University. Office of the Vice Provost for Research

did.abstract: The Office of the Vice Provost for Research at New York University (RG 5.9) works to serve and support faculty and researchers across NYU campuses in conducting research, entrepeneurship, and other sponsored, scholarly activities. The Federal Research Hub, launched in 2025, links to information about changes in federal policy that affect ongoing and new federal funding for research at New York University (NYU).

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Material pertaining to individual student records may be restricted in accordance with the Family Educational Rights and Privacy Act (FERPA). Please contact the Archives with specific questions regarding access to such records.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: This collection is protected by copyright and/or related rights. You are free to use materials in the collection in any way that is permitted by the copyright and related rights legislation that applies to your use. For other uses you need to obtain permission from the rights-holder(s).

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: To cite the archived website in this collection: Identification of item, date; Records of the Office of the Vice Provost for Research; RG 5.9; Wayback URL; University Archives, New York University.

appraisal.head: Appraisal
appraisal.p: Archived websites are made accessible for purposes of education and research. NYU Libraries have given attribution to rights holders when possible; however, due to the nature of archival collections, we are not always able to identify this information.
If you hold the rights to materials in our archived websites that are unattributed, please let us know so that we may maintain accurate information about these materials.

If you are a rights holder and are concerned that you have found material on this website for which you have not granted permission (or is not covered by a copyright exception under US copyright laws), you may request the removal of the material from our site by submitting a notice, with the elements described below, to the special.collections@nyu.edu.

Please include the following in your notice: Identification of the material that you believe to be infringing and information sufficient to permit us to locate the material; your contact information, such as an address, telephone number, and email address; a statement that you are the owner, or authorized to act on behalf of the owner, of an exclusive right that is allegedly infringed and that you have a good-faith belief that use of the material in the manner complained of is not authorized by the copyright owner, its agent, or the law; a statement that the information in the notification is accurate and made under penalty of perjury; and your physical or electronic signature. Upon receiving a notice that includes the details listed above, we will remove the allegedly infringing material from public view while we assess the issues identified in your notice.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: Due to technical or privacy issues, archived websites may not be exact copies of the original website at the time of the web crawl. Certain file types will not be captured dependent on how they are embedded in the site. Other parts of websites that the crawler has difficulty capturing includes Javascript, streaming content, database-driven content, and highly interactive content. Full-Text searches of archived websites are available at https://archive-it.org/organizations/567.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: New site crawls are accrued semiannually.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Federal Research Hub webpage links to information about changes in federal policy that affect ongoing and new federal funding for research at New York University (NYU). It contains information on the latest news regarding executive orders, directives to Federal agencies and other Federal development and their impact. The website also includes links to communications issued by NYU and other organizations as well as Federal Government communications.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The Office of the Vice Provost for Research at New York University (RG 5.9) works to serve and support faculty and researchers across NYU campuses in the United States, Abu Dhabi, and Shanghai in conducting research, entrepeneurship, and other sponsored, scholarly activities. In January 2025, the Federal Administration issued executive orders that impacted research at NYU that was supported by federal funding, which led to the launch of the Federal Update Hub.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: In January 2025, https://www.nyu.edu/research/resources-and-support-offices/federally-funded-research-update-hub.html was selected for captured by Janet Bunde through the use of Archive-It. Archive-It uses web crawling technology to capture websites at a scheduled time and displays only an archived copy, from the resulting WARC file, of the website. The accession number associated with this website is 2025.013.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: In March 2025, a resource record was created for record group 5.9 and the archived website was added to the finding aid.

daodesc.p: Federal Update Hub Archived Website: January 2025-ongoing
